pathAssistantSteps.info: Basic principles observed and reported: This level represents the earliest stage of technology development, where the basic principles of the technology have been identified and reported in scientific literature.
Technology concept formulated: This level represents the development of a conceptual design or plan for the technology, based on scientific principles and preliminary data.

Analytical and experimental critical function and/or characteristic proof of concept: This level represents the testing and validation of critical functions or characteristics of the technology in a laboratory or simulated environment.

Component and/or breadboard validation in laboratory environment: This level represents the testing and validation of a prototype or basic model of the technology in a laboratory or simulated environment.

Component and/or breadboard validation in relevant environment: This level represents the testing and validation of a prototype or basic model of the technology in a relevant environment or setting, such as a field test or pilot study.

System/subsystem model or prototype demonstration in a relevant environment: This level represents the testing and validation of a more advanced model or prototype of the technology in a relevant environment or setting, demonstrating its performance and capabilities.

System prototype demonstration in an operational environment: This level represents the testing and validation of a full-scale prototype or model of the technology in an operational environment, demonstrating its performance and readiness for commercialization.
Actual system completed and qualified through test and demonstration: This level represents the completion of a fully functional and qualified system, ready for commercialization and deployment.

Actual system proven through successful mission operations: This level represents the successful implementation and deployment of the technology in a real-world setting, demonstrating its effectiveness and reliability.
